Information.Name: button
Information.Containers: htmlcontainer, dialog, dialog_2, container, tablecell, vdomclass, accordeon, flexcontainer

Language.Sentence: The Button type produces an object displayed as a button, that provides a way to trigger an event. It can also be used as an external or an internal hyperlink. There are the following ways of displaying the Button object: if the 'Text' attribute is set, the object will be displayed as a hyperlink; if a 'Button image' attribute is set, the object will be displayed as a button; if none of these attributes is set, the default image will be displayed; if both attributes are set, both image and text will be displayed.
Order of rendering the object on the page. By default the value of hierarchy is 0, that means, that the object will be rendered in the order it is written in the XML-file of the VDOM application.

Position in visual hierarchy of objects. If you have several objects in one container situated on each other, the z-index indicates the order of their displaying. The larger z-index is, the upper the object lies.
Spacing between the top edge of the container and the object in pixels.
Spacing from the left edge of the parent object to the current object in pixels.
Width of the object in pixels.
Height of the object in pixels.

The index number of switching the elements on pressing the Tab key. If the TabIndex is the same for all elements, they will be switched in the order they are written in the XML file of the application. If you want to switch the elements in a definite order, set the TabIndex attribute so that each next element's TabIndex was more then the previous one.
A bubble help that is shown when the cursor points at the object.
The image of the object (image’s resource identifier). This attribute can not be set up together with the Text attribute.
The the image of the object (image’s resource identifier) that is shown when the cursor points at it.
The the image of the object (image’s resource identifier) if the Disabled attribute is set to Yes.
The hyperlink to the external page. If the Container and the External link are determined at the same time - the priority is given to the External link.
The hyperlink to the internal HTML container. If the Container and the External link are determined at the same time - the priority is given to the External link.
The highlighting of the object when the cursor points at it.
The pressed state of the button.
Define if the object is active or not. It is useful when you want to display the button which is inactive at the moment, but which is active in another circumstances.
The border width of the object in pixels
The font type of the object.
The font size of the object in points.
The name of the CSS class.
The CSS style of the object. If the user changes CSS style, the Skin attribute is changed to the "User defined".

The visual appearance of the object (ProSuite, User defined). If you select any skin, the CSS is copied to the Style attribute, so if you want to switch skin back to the User defined, you will have to delete everything from the Style attribute.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 99.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 9999.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer | auto.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer | auto.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 999999.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 999999.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer.
Incorrect value, must be valid text.
Incorrect value, must contain only printable characters.
Incorrect file, must be the image’s resource identifier.
Incorrect file, must be the image’s resource identifier.
Incorrect file, must be the image’s resource identifier.
Incorrect value, must be a valid link.
Incorrect value, must be valid internal container.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 99.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 0 to 99.
Incorrect value, must be positive integer from 1 to 9999.
Move the object to a new position
Change position in visual hierarchy of objects
Set new text inside the object
Fade effect, time is indicated in milliseconds
visual effect of moving, time is indicated in milliseconds
String to load into Text attribute
Fade effect, time is indicated in milliseconds
Hiérarchie de l'objet, ordre de chargement de l'objet par rapport aux autres
Niveau de superposition de l'objet par rapport aux autres
Distance depuis le bord haut de l'objet parent en pixels
Distance depuis le bord gauche de l'objet parent en pixels
Texte alternatif, s'affichant au survol de l'objet
Lien vers une page web externe
Liens vers une rubrique interne du site
Epaisseur de la bordure de l'objet en pixels
Style de police : italique ou normal
Graisse de la police : gras ou normal
Décoration du texte : souligné ou pas
Décalage du texte par rapport au bord de l'image du bouton
Valeur Incorrecte, doit être comprise entre 0 et 99
Valeur Incorrecte, doit être un texte valide
Valeur Incorrecte, ne doit comporter que des caractères imprimables
Fichier Incorrect, doit être un fichier image
Fichier Incorrect, doit être un fichier image
Valeur Incorrecte, doit être un lien valide
Valeur Incorrecte, doit être un lien valide vers un conteneur interne valide
Valeur Incorrecte, doit être compris entre 1 et 4

Set button image when the cursor is over
